page.title: 13ZYLLAH COOKE AT OLD WINDSOR
page.content:
On 28th June 1985 we met Zyllah Cooke at Old Windsor Lock;she had been at Sunbury at 6.30 a.m. because her Save Our Swan organisation had had a report of a swan on the Thames with a fishing line and eight pieces of lead weight hanging from its beak.Now she and volunteer assistant Tim Heron were looking for a family of swans with a sick cygnet;the lock-keeper told them he had heard of them at Runnymede that morning. Zyllah carried a swan net and pole each with expandable handles used to capture the injured swans. As we were leaving we learned that they were trying to borrow a boat to row down-river to Runnymede to search for the family of swans.
by Alexander,Sarah,Michelle
